intro: Conocephalus suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented conocephalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, particularly China and India, and thrives in temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance. Conocephalus suaveolens is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
